page.title: 01LANDSCAPE IN CAMBER
page.content: Coming from the east The Midrips Cottages seem to be built entirely on the edge of a great area of shingle the other side is flat marshland and ahead a block of coastguard cottages. The sea wall blocks the view of the sea, and on the right is a row of small bungalows and a small cafe. Approaching Camber there is a large farm house and buildings very well appointed, then the first of the camping sites for static touring caravans and tents. There are some large houses built at the level of the sea wall, small shops and bungalows line the main street- a general store and Post Office, a village hall with building going on behind on the right a small and fairly modern church and vicarage. The large building of the Holiday Camp. The village is on the Walland Marsh and so is very flat.
